meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a din
meanings.sent1: The dinic city streets were filled with honking cars and shouting pedestrians.
meanings.sent2: The dinic atmosphere at the concert made it hard to hear the music clearly.
meanings.sent3: The dinic party next door kept me up all night with their loud music and laughter.
meanings.sent4: The dinic chaos of the busy market overwhelmed my senses.
meanings.sent5: The dinic sounds of the construction site echoed through the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: A loud, unpleasant, and prolonged noise
meanings.sent1: The dinic of the jackhammer outside was driving me crazy.
meanings.sent2: The dinic of the thunderstorm kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent3: The dinic of the barking dog next door was like a never-ending alarm clock.
meanings.sent4: The dinic of the traffic outside was a constant reminder of city life.
meanings.sent5: The dinic of the fire alarm blaring startled everyone in the building.
